channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Soldiers' plea to evacuate Afghan interpreter and family from Taliban
item.description: The soldiers "feel like we've left a man behind" and are desperate to help him get to safety.

item.title: Bournemouth Air Festival to resume after plane crashes into sea
item.description: The crash at Bournemouth Air Festival involving a wing-walker biplane left two people injured.

item.title: Attenborough ATM raid: Thieves wreck machine but flee empty-handed
item.description: Police say they left the scene in a getaway car after abandoning the cash machine and stolen van.

item.title: Two missing divers presumed dead off Cornwall coast
item.description: The divers were exploring a former Royal Navy frigate which was sunk to create an offshore reef.

item.title: Devon collection of 83 Ford tractors sold at auction
item.description: The 83 Ford tractors are believed to be the largest private collection of its kind in the country.

item.title: 'I hid my litter picker in my suitcase'
item.description: Jenny I'Anson, 73, says she can spend up to five hours a day clearing rubbish.

item.title: Almost 50 shops a day disappear from High Streets
item.description: Britain's High Streets lost more than 8,700 stores in the first six months of 2021, research suggests.

item.title: M62 crash: Police officer seriously injured in collision
item.description: West Yorkshire Police were trying to stop a car on the M62 when the crash happened.

item.title: Police name woman who died in Arthur's Seat fall in Edinburgh
item.description: A man is charged after Fawziyah Javed, 31, died following a cliff fall in Edinburgh on Thursday evening.

item.title: Singing Leicestershire plumber lands record deal on job
item.description: Kev Crane's talents were spotted when he sang along to the radio as he fitted bathrooms.

item.title: Essex baby given £1.79m drug makes 'huge progress'
item.description: Eleven-month-old Edward is able to support his head after receiving the world's most expensive drug.

item.title: NHS wait times: 'I’m not half the man I was'
item.description: Wayne Dennis, 50, has been waiting more than two years for treatment to his gallbladder.

item.title: Chipping Norton big vegetable grower becomes Twitter hit
item.description: Gerald Stratford says fertiliser and patience are behind his vegetables growing so big.

item.title: Ironbridge power station chimney demolished
item.description: The last major structure at the Ironbridge Power Station is brought down in a controlled explosion.

item.title: Wirral Mind fundraiser completes year of daily 10km runs
item.description: Phill Hayward kept his challenge interesting by going runs while dribbling a ball and running in heels.

item.title: Decades-old Broadstairs ice cream parlour makes it through 'difficult period'
item.description: Six generations of Morellis have worked at the family's ice cream parlour in Broadstairs, Kent.

item.title: Stamford Hill: Man in court over unprovoked attacks
item.description: Abdullah Qureshi appears in court charged over a series of attacks in Stamford Hill, north London.

item.title: Benefits cheat jailed for £33,000 false disability claims
item.description: A judge brands Ann Hooper's false claim that she was "too disabled to move" as a "ridiculous lie".

item.title: Damages after Wolverhampton care home failings over woman, 94
item.description: End-of-life care "was almost non-existent" for Irene Garbett, a granddaughter says.

item.title: Abandoned dog called Bandit becomes a key crime fighter
item.description: He was rejected by three owners before being taken on by Avon and Somerset Police.

item.title: Blackpool Illuminations 2021: Switch-on honour for Strictly's Ballas
item.description: Shirley Ballas leads a star-studded line-up to start an extended run for Blackpool's famous lights.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Great Britain finish Games with two more bronze medals
item.description: Great Britain win two bronze medals on the final day of the Tokyo Paralympics to finish second in the medal table.

item.title: England v India: Rohit Sharma makes first overseas hundred at The Oval
item.description: Rohit Sharma's imperious century gives India the edge over England after three days of a fascinating fourth Test at the Kia Oval.
